A fun fact about me is that I learned coding when 11 years, from Turbo Pascal to experimenting with Fox Pro, Microsoft Access, and Visual Basic.

Since then, I've had the opportunity of working in different systems such as ERP Systems, Stock Management, Payroll, Attendance & eCommerce.

I've also worked in different roles including SQL, Web & Mobile App Dev, Test Automation and Data Integration.

bio:
Ankshita is currently working as a cybersecurity consultant in the paradise island of Mauritius, helping the biggest firms around the world implement strategic cybersecurity best practices and comply with the required standards. Previously she has worked in cybersecurity for approximately two years as a SOC analyst, thus gathering a rich hands-on experience on blue teaming tools and practices. 

Ankshita has presented her cyber blue teaming skills at the DevCon2023, the biggest developers' conference of Mauritius organized by the MSCC and GDG Mauritius. She recently also spoke at the DevFest 2023 about introducing Golang to students. 

Coming from a diverse background in Information Technology, Ankshita is familiar with development and programming in Java, Python, Javascript and Solidity. Her latest passion for learning narrows down to Golang which can be very effectively implemented in the field of cybersecurity as well. 

During university years, Ankshita has also represented the Google Developers Student Clubs on her campus at the University of Mauritius and she had also been elected as the Huawei Campus Ambassador.

I have led project teams ranging from 5 to up to 80 team members across different geographies with portfolio of > EUR4.5million per year.

Currently in his final year at Middlesex University Mauritius, studying Computer Science Systems Engineering, Girish has shifted his focus from organizing to supporting IT-related events and workshops. This effort aims to bridge the gap between academic learning and industry demands. With expanded responsibilities at work, where he plays a pivotal role in navigating security challenges and mentoring his team, Girish's passion for advancing in the security field continues unabated. His technical proficiency spans Linux, Bash, Python, the Elastic Stack (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana, Beats), Docker, Ansible, Wazuh, LDAP, and more, underpinning his versatile skill set and deep understanding of various technologies.

bio:
Riyad is an esteemed academic member of the Department of Creative Arts, Film and Media Technologies (CAFMT) at the University of Technology, Mauritius (UTM). He has imparted his knowledge and expertise in various university modules, including Game Development, Video Editing, Creative Design, Multimedia & Applications, Audio-visual Production, Systems Integration and Web Design.
As academic background, Riyad holds a postgraduate degree in Software Engineering and is working towards obtaining his PhD. Before his career in academia, Riyad was the Systems Analyst at UTM, during which he earned several certifications from prominent tech corporations such as Microsoft, Adobe, and Linux. His proficiency in these areas garnered him prestigious titles like Microsoft Certified Trainer and Adobe Certified Instructor. He has, however, an affinity for Linux.
Venturing into the realm of research, Riyad undertook a Research Training Fellowship at India's renowned Centre for Development of Advanced Computing (C-DAC). This experience significantly influenced his professional focus, shifting from pursuing certifications to concentrating on academic publishing.
Riyad warmly welcomes intellectual discussions and is eager to expand his professional network. He seeks potential collaborations to bridge the gap between industry and academia and is enthusiastic about exploring opportunities with research funding agencies. Encouraging connection and communication, Riyad invites the reader to reach out to him with any inquiries, prospective partnerships, or exchange ideas.

bio: Zaahra is a forward-thinking Software Engineer who develops innovative solutions and navigates the entrepreneurial tech landscape. As an ambassador for Google's Womentech Makers, she offers mentorship and writes technical articles to advance tech education. Additionally, Zaahra provides guidance under the Google Developer Student Clubs initiative. Known for her successful orchestration of tech workshops, she is deeply committed to mentoring individuals in the tech community. Her public speaking engagements highlight her dedication to inspiring young women in technology and addressing key issues within the industry.
tagLine: Software Engineer| Google Women Techmakers | Google Developer Student Clubs Mentor

bio:
Zafir is a versatile software engineer with expertise in various web technologies and frameworks, including Node.js, Angular, Ember.js, and React. He also specializes in mobile app development across hybrid platforms, Android, and iOS using Objective-C and Swift. With a strong focus on delivering high-quality solutions, Zafir is adept at simplifying complex topics and sharing best practices with the developer community. His experience and passion for technology make him a valuable mentor and speaker.

For more information, visit his personal website, zfir.dev.
